channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 50% of U.S. military bases face health care access issues; Tony Awards takeaways
item.description: An NPR investigation found that 50% of U.S. military bases are in so-called "health care deserts." There weren't any surprises at last night's Tony Awards — except for the winner of Best Musical.
item.content:encoded:
An NPR investigation found that 50% of U.S. military bases are in so-called "health care deserts." There weren't any surprises at last night's Tony Awards — except for the winner of Best Musical.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Nicknamed Caramelo, a rescued horse from the flooding in Brazil, becomes famous
item.description: In Brazil, a seven-year-old horse who survived catastrophic floods in the south of the country has become a symbol of hope.
item.content:encoded: In Brazil, a seven-year-old horse who survived catastrophic floods in the south of the country has become a symbol of hope.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: N.D. Gov. Burgum has surfaced as a top contender to be Trump’s running mate
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to Mark Jendrysik, a professor at the University of North Dakota, about why Donald Trump may be leaning toward Gov. Doug Burgum as a potential vice presidential pick.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin talks to Mark Jendrysik, a professor at the University of North Dakota, about why Donald Trump may be leaning toward Gov. Doug Burgum as a potential vice presidential pick.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: World leaders met in Switzerland to discuss a roadmap to peace for Ukraine
item.description: Envoys and leaders of more than 90 nations participated, and most signed a statement saying Ukraine’s borders must be respected in any deal to end the war. Russia wasn't invited to the meeting.
item.content:encoded: Envoys and leaders of more than 90 nations participated, and most signed a statement saying Ukraine’s borders must be respected in any deal to end the war. Russia wasn't invited to the meeting.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Uber and Lyft are fighting minimum wage laws. But in this state, the drivers won
item.description: Internal emails, interviews and in-app messages show Uber and Lyft deployed a powerful lobbying playbook to stop minimum wage laws in Minnesota. But drivers had a playbook of their own.
item.content:encoded:
Internal emails, interviews and in-app messages show Uber and Lyft deployed a powerful lobbying playbook to stop minimum wage laws in Minnesota. But drivers had a playbook of their own.

(Image credit: Jenn Ackerman for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Dara Kerr

item.title: People with HIV are aging, and the challenges are piling up
item.description: Aging with HIV comes with an increased risk of other health problems. Failing to get adequate care could undermine fighting the virus. (Story aired on Weekend Edition Saturday on June 15, 2024.)
item.content:encoded: Aging with HIV comes with an increased risk of other health problems. Failing to get adequate care could undermine fighting the virus. (Story aired on Weekend Edition Saturday on June 15, 2024.)
item.dc:creator: Sam Whitehead

item.title: 5 takeaways from the 2024 Tony Awards
item.description: There were very few surprises during Sunday's Tony Awards, except for one: best musical. The final award of the night went to The Outsiders, the adaptation of S.E. Hinton’s beloved book.
item.content:encoded:
There were very few surprises during Sunday's Tony Awards, except for one: best musical. The final award of the night went to The Outsiders, the adaptation of S.E. Hinton’s beloved book.

(Image credit: Theo Wargo)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Vanasco

item.title: Half of the U.S. military bases nationwide are in 'health care deserts'
item.description: For hundreds of thousands of U.S. troops and their families, when the Pentagon orders them to find health care off base there is none.
item.content:encoded:
For hundreds of thousands of U.S. troops and their families, when the Pentagon orders them to find health care off base there is none.

(Image credit: Lance Corporal Aaron K. Fiala/U.S. Marine Corps)
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence

item.title: A retired federal judge says Judge Cannon appears to show 'favoritism' toward Trump
item.description: Some of Judge Aileen Cannon’s decisions in Trump's Florida classified documents case have baffled one former judge, who gives her assessment of the case so far.
item.content:encoded:
Some of Judge Aileen Cannon’s decisions in Trump's Florida classified documents case have baffled one former judge, who gives her assessment of the case so far.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Some TikTok influencers are maligning sunscreen. Here's what to know about the claims
item.description: Sunscreen is the best way to protect ourselves against skin cancer. But doctors are concerned by a backlash against sunscreen that is spreading on social media.
item.content:encoded:
Sunscreen is the best way to protect ourselves against skin cancer. But doctors are concerned by a backlash against sunscreen that is spreading on social media.

(Image credit: Anna Vishnyak)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy
